sentences.en: He is indenture to a builder.
sentences.cn: 他与一建筑工人订了师徒合同.

sentences.en: Soon thereafter, private agents scoured the ports taverns, and countryside to sign on workers for indenture.
sentences.cn: 此后不久，私人机构迅速搜查港口的小客栈和乡下地区，来招募契约仆役。

sentences.en: The contract represents an entrance into a state of mutual indenture of the twoparticipants.
sentences.cn: 合同标志着两个参与者共有契约状态的进入。

sentences.en: Thirdly, the paper illustrates the life cycle of agriculture VR&DO and discusses the operating mode of it on the basis of dynamic network indenture.
sentences.cn: 再次，论文阐述了农业虚拟研发组织的生命周期，并论述了基于动态网契约的农业虚拟研发组织的运行模式。

sentences.en: To bind into the service of another by indenture.
sentences.cn: 以契约约束按契约的规定为另一方服务.

words.tran_cn: 犬牙交错的；受契约约束的；缩进排印的
缩进；切割成锯齿状（indent的过去分词）
以契约约束；签订契约（indenture的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 契约，合同，正式凭单，文据
trans.tran_en: a formal contract, especially in the past, between an apprentice and his master(= employer ), or the act of arranging this
to enter into an agreement by indenture
